title: Omotenashi
description: The concept of wholehearted, selfless giving, attention to detail, and anticipation of others’ needs all without an expectation of a return or even of being noticed.

title: Mottainai
description: The spirit of appreciating what you have been entrusted with and showing respect for what you have been entrusted with and the one who has entrusted it to you.

title: Shokunin
description: Japanese for ‘Craftsman’, it is being dedicated to the work itself, and seeing it done excellently all the way through.
It is taking the time to do things right, especially when no one will notice because it is good for the soul.

title: Wabi-sabi
description: Perfectly imperfect — simple yet complex — recognizing the pursuit of perfection is vain.
There is always something you can improve, at the same time taking satisfaction in simply achieving the work set before you, and doing it well.

title: Shoshin
description: Meaning "beginner's mind", it is an inquisitive approach to problems that seeks first to understand.
Explore all solutions, avoiding preconceived notions and premature judgements before connecting the dots — some for the first time — to a path forward.
